clinical_study.brief_title: Is There a Transient Rebound Effect of Platelet Reactivity Following Cessation of Dual Antiplatelet Therapy With Ticagrelor - a Single Center Prospective Observational Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Is There a Transient Rebound Effect of Platelet Reactivity Following Cessation of Dual Antiplatelet Therapy With Ticagrelor - a Single Center Prospective Observational Trial

brief_summary.textblock: to assess whether cessation of 12 months DAPT regimen containing Ticagrelor results in a hyperreactive phase of platelet function

detailed_description.textblock: the study will be composed of a cohort of patients , who completed 12 months of DAPT with Ticagrelor (standard recommended dose for ACS - 90 mg BID), did not experience any clinical or adverse event during this time period and are about to discontinue Ticagrelor. We intend to measure the platelet reactivity for each patient on 4 time points - prior to cessation of Ticagrelor (i.e. while still on DAPT) and 1,4 and 12 weeks post discontinuation of therapy. There will not be a control group.

primary_outcome.time_frame: from 1 week prior to 12 weeks post DAPT cessation

arm_group.description: Patients planned for cessation of DAPT regimen containing Ticagrelor after 12 months of treatment following coronary stent implantation . the platelet reactivity will be assessed 1 week prior to cessation of DAPT and than at 1,3,and 12 weeks post DAPT cessation.

intervention.description: assessment of platelet aggregation using the VerifyNow purinergic receptor P2Y, G-protein coupled, 12 (P2Y12) platelet function assay (Accumetrics, San Diego, California)

study_pop.textblock: Patients who underwent coronary stent implantation and completed 12 months of DAPT regimen with Ticagrelor with no clinical or adverse events.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age>18
- underwent coronary stent implantation due to ACS
- completed 12 month of DAPT regimen containing Ticagrelor at standard dose (90 mg BID)
Exclusion Criteria:
- any ischemic or bleeding events while under Ticagrelor
- any other Ticagrelor associated adverse effects
- planned for continuation of Ticagrelor for more than 12months post stenting according to the judgment of the attending physician.
- Unable to make informed consent .
